column4: Why did I have less workspace on Ubuntu than I have at the same resolution with XP?
Are you sure the resolution is the same?
yes
maybe I need the nvidia propeitary driver?
That's what I'm using. If the resolutions are identical, there is the same amount of room.
I will try with nvidia driver installed :) ty
You might, as vyr said, have more than one toolbar or something that is taking up room.
I'm not sure why a nvidia driver would disable your internet, I suspect something else happened.
When I think to this, I have also installed XChat, maybe it have changed something. I will try to desinstall it
Did you try looking at your network settings after the net didn't work?
yes. manual setup don't change anything
- wols_ : I will try to restart it, just find the command. Maybe it will correct the problem

If the net settings are still the same, the nvidia driver or xchat didn't do anything. I would suggest a few internet specific checks, such as making the ethernet cable is plugged in, etc, unless it is dual boot with XP.
Restarting is a good place to start.
I meant to ask you this earlier, but how are you comparing sizes?
number of item fitting in screen. simple as that. icons are bigger, I have less bookmarks for a given space in firefox, etc
Did you ever get your internet working again? Twinity may be right, it might be an incorrect DPI setting.
yes the network is ok now. I have set off HPTE and Memory protection off in bios. I'm not sure if it is related. I will take a look at DPI
I have changed the font size by 2 point to arrive to something equivalent. that's crazy to waste so much space by default
So is the font equivalent to that in XP? I just messed with mine for the first time in a while and like the extra space I get.
But I'm running at 3200x1050 so it doesn't make so much difference for me.
ok. I don't know for sure about the font equivalent with XP. It's working and I'm happy with it :P. ty
np
